qas.question: What kind of linguistics describes how factors of languages change in history?
With the passage of time what particular things phonemic in a language are known to change?
In the past sounds that now belong to separate phonemes were allophones of what kind of phoneme in English?
What kind of linguistics describes how factors of phenomes change in history?
With the passage of phenomes what particular things phonemic in a language are known to change?
In the past sounds that now belong to separate phenomes were allophones of what kind  of change in English?

plausible_answers.text: The particular contrasts which are phonemic in a language

qas.question: Where is historical change of time described?

context: <b6_0>The particular <a1_0><b4_0>contrasts<b4_0/><a1_0/> which are phonemic in a language<b6_0/> can change over time. At one time, [f] and [v], two sounds that have the same place and manner of articulation and differ in voicing only, were allophones of <a2_0><b5_0>the same phoneme<b5_0/><a2_0/> in English, but later came to belong to separate phonemes. This is one of the main factors of <b3_0>historical<b3_0/> change of languages as described in <a0_0><b7_0>historical<a0_0/> linguistics<b7_0/>.
